snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry sought to send the message that the deal to eliminate Syria’s chemical weapons did not signal a weakening of the Obama administration’s stance on Iran.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry seeks to send message to world, in whirlwind trip to allied capitals, that agreement struck to eliminate Syria's chemical weapons does not signal a weakening of Obama administration's stance on Iran.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Paris, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Maia de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry sought to send the message that the deal to eliminate Syria’s chemical weapons did not signal a weakening of the Obama administration’s stance on Iran.

headline.main: In Wake of Syria Deal, Kerry Emphasizes Iran
headline.print_headline: In Wake of Syria Deal, Kerry Emphasizes Iran
